div.head: John Thomas Will
div.p:
In the name of God Amen. The 17th day of April 1680
I John Thomas of Charles County in the province of Maryland being of
perfect minde and memory praised be god do make and ordain this
my last will and testament in manner and form following First
and principally I bequeath my soul into the hands of Almight my
maker hoping that through the minitasiaus Death and passion of Jesus
Christ my only saviour and redeemer to receive free pardon and forgiveness
of all my sins and as for my body to be buried in Christian buriall
at the discression of my Executor hereafter named and for such wordly
goods as it hath or shall please God to bless me withall and whereof I shall
be p at the time of my decrease I fully absolutely and wholy give and
bequeath unto my dear and loving friend John Maugh of Patomack in
the county of Stafford Clerk u home I make my Executor of this my last will
and testament and in care of his Death to and amongst the children
of the said John Maugh or the surviver of them equally to be divided
shore and share alike Excepting five hundred pounds of tobacco which
I give and bequeath unto my kind and loving George
Neale
